home.title: Taste and See, that the Lord is good... Here's how in 5 steps
home.subTitle: Multiple languages? Many different needs? No problem
home.catalogTitle: Check out these categories and what tools are available.

steps.title: Explore
steps.description: Experience and feedback from communities from around the world has taught us that there are 8 major conditions that determine if people will use their Bible and lives will be transformed. In the EXPLORE section, we help you understand each of these conditions and to assess them in your community.

steps.title: Decide
steps.description: On the Decide section you will consider possible tools and strategies that will help strengthen the weak conditions in your situation. When we strengthen those conditions, it increases the impact God’s Word will have.

steps.title: Basket
steps.description: On the Basket Page you will see all of the tools you have chosen and are currently in Your Community Basket. Whether you have selected just a few tools or many, here you will begin to make decisions about how to proceed with your tools. You can also share your selections and see what your peers are saying.

steps.title: Roadmap
steps.description: A person could set out on a journey without a plan, but a little planning can go a long way to keep us from starting out in the wrong direction, making a wrong turn, or running out of resources so we never get to our destination. That is what the RoadMap page is all about. It will help you plan so that you can make it to your destination, and that you can make it with as few setbacks and frustrations as possible.

steps.title: Stay Connected
steps.description: There are a lot of ways you can Stay Connected with your peers around the world. Upload photos and videos showing the tools your Community used, write some helpful reviews, tell some stories, or chat about things your community learned or ask questions you may have.

qa.ans: Taste&See is a web-based Scripture engagement tool that helps churches and those who serve them get a clearer picture of their own setting and of what Bible products would really help their community.

Taste&See uses a diagnostic tool—based on Wayne Dye’s Eight Conditions—to help assess the situation of the community. And it provides a catalog of many Bible tools and activities that churches might want to use in the languages that work best for them. They can decide to translate those products and in others ways make them fit their setting.

qa.que: Can I navigate through the website without registering and signing in?
qa.ans: Yes, you can. You are free to navigate through Step 3—so up to adding tools and reviewing your what you have put in your basket.

qa.que: Will my basket be saved, if I do not have a registered User ID?
qa.ans: Your basket will be active for that particular session that you are online. Once you close the browser you will be able to retrieve your basket till your browser cache is not cleared.

qa.que: Can I create multiple baskets for multiple languages that I would like to assess?
qa.ans: Yes, you can, but you do need to register and sign in for that. Once you have done that, choose a language first and then create a basket. You can repeat the steps 1-3 for the next language. To switch between baskets, simply type the required language basket that you’d like to view, in the language text bar.

qa.que: How can I use the Stay Connected Step?
qa.ans: That feature is not working yet but is in development with be released in the near future.

qa.que: If I need any help, how can I get that?
qa.ans: Nearly all tools provide contact information help with that specific tool. But if you need help related to Taste&See, want some general advice, or have a question, please, contact us at info@tastesee.org.

qa.que: What if I notice a mistake or a technical problem?
qa.ans: Yes, please help us and let us know what’s amiss. Write to us at info@tastesee.org

qa.que: What if my organization has a tool (product, activity or description) to add to the Catalog?
qa.ans: Great! We seek to give our community the most helpful tools. So, please, contact us at info@tastesee.org about your tool.

offline.title: Taste&See OFFLINE APP INSTALLATION STEPS
method1List: Click on 'Offline App', link. Save the app installation file to your PC
Open Chrome browser and go to Menu > Settings > Extensions page
Switch on 'Developer mode' on the top right corner of the Extensions page. (Note, this can be switched off after installation).
Click and drag the downloaded installation file (TasteSee.crx) to the extensions page
A new popup will appear asking you to 'Add Taste and See Offline?'
Click on the Add App button to complete the installation. Taste and See offline app will now be installed as a Chrome App and the logo will appear in the Chrome apps list.
The apps list can be accessed by clicking the 'Apps' button at the top left of the browser page.
Click on the Taste and See logo to open the offline App.
method2List: Click on 'Offline App' link. Save the app installation file to your PC.
Open Chrome browser and type chrome://extension on the address bar to open the extension page.
Switch on 'Developer mode' on the top right corner of the extensions page. (Note, this can be switched off after installation).
Click and drag the downloaded installation file to the extensions page.
A new popup will appear asking you to 'Add Taste and See Offline?'

Click on the Add App to complete the installation. The Taste and See will get installed as a Chrome App and the logo will appear in the apps list. The apps list can be accessed by clicking the 'Apps' button at the top left of the browser page
Click on the Taste and See logo to open the offline App.
offline.note: Note: the computer needs to be online while the installation is in progress so that the App data synchronisation can take place.
offline.instructionSubtitle: To Open Taste and See offline app (after installation):
instructionList: Open Apps page by clicking 'Apps' on the top left corner of the page.
Click on the Taste and See logo to launch the Offline App.
Login page appears. Please log in using your Taste&See login and password.
Start using the offline version of the app.
Whenever the System is connected to the internet, click on the 'Sync now' button to sync your data with the server.
Note 1: Once offline app is installed, the user can use just that since all features of the online app is also available in the offline version as well.

Note 2: There is an option to sync your data with the server so that is saved and and retained for your future. However, the user can choose never to sync with the server to keep their data on their own PC.
